alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Coastal Jefferson; Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 21 at 3:58AM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...HARD FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT THURSDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the Hard Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 24 possible Friday morning. Temperatures could be as low as 21 Saturday morning. * WHERE...The Southshore of Lakes Pontchartrain and Maurepas. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from midnight Thursday night to noon CST Friday. For the Hard Freeze Watch, from Thursday evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
